testimony.quarrel_subject: Jean wanted to attack billeted soldiers; Jean threw himself against witness's dagger and was wounded
testimony.threat_quote: he would make him as poor as himself

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 2 days after Claudin touched the horse

testimony.quarrel_subject: refused to sell 2 pigs to Claudin, wanted to fatten them more herself

testimony.threat_quote: qu'il se donneroit de garde bientost

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after the quarrel, then cured when witness confronted Claudin

witnesses.name: Colas Thouvenin
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, had business dealings with Jean

testimony.quarrel_subject: withdrew 2 cows belonging to his wife which Jean had leased; dispute over payment of pence and wine
testimony.threat_quote: he would not keep them long, or make a profit on them

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: returned from herd limping, recovered after Claudin came to see it

witnesses.name: Izabellon femme à Jean Petit Jean

harms_alleged.target_relationship: husband's horse that was lent to Jean
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: returned sick after being lent for ploughing, died
3 weeks before testimony, returned lame from herd, recovered after Claudin felt along its leg

testimony.quarrel_subject: dispute over buying meadow hay - witness bought for 4 francs, Claudin offered 6 francs, witness refused to buy twice
testimony.threat_quote: he would repent of this hay

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: immediately after incident at well following Jean Braconnier's execution
soon after subsidy dispute, recovered after Claudin visited

testimony.quarrel_subject: subsidy dispute, Claudin as village herdsman thought he shouldn't pay

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: about 15 days after Jean Braconnier execution incident, recovered when Claudin visited

testimony.quarrel_subject: told story of warning Mongin Viriot that Claudin was angry over subsidy
dispute with Claudin about his son 4 months earlier

witnesses.name: Claudotte fille de feu Claudon Didellot

testimony.quarrel_subject: Jean owed her 11 francs for corn and rent, refused to pay
testimony.threat_quote: he might see her begging for her livelihood

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: same day after being persuaded to take bread, became demented for 23 weeks
6 years before, ill for 2 years after beating

testimony.quarrel_subject: refused to show Jean Aulbry pears she had been gathering

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: beaten with grey stick three times, ill for 2 years
day after not inviting Claudin to drink, died after 6 weeks

testimony.quarrel_subject: Claudin complaining about not enough help with herd, witness said predecessors had no more

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: next day fell ill, died a month later

testimony.quarrel_subject: stood guarantor for 72 franc loan to Jean from Demenge Guenot; had to pay and constrain Jean to reimburse
testimony.threat_quote: he would not gain from it

timeline.subject: Jean and Claudin Aulbry
timeline.details: Informations preparatoires taken by Claude Borduet, prévôt of Chastenoy, at request of PG des Vosges

timeline.subject: Jean and Claudin Aulbry
timeline.details: Account of mysterious knocking and spirit visit to guarded accused on previous Saturday night

timeline.subject: Claudin Aulbry
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses, denied all charges

timeline.subject: Jean Aulbry
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses, denied all charges, alleged Nicolas Thouvenin was convicted of selling bad meat and was a thief

timeline.subject: Jean Aulbry
timeline.details: PG des Vosges records Jean Aulbry's violent death by suicide at instigation of devil; requests body be hung and goods confiscated; also asks for question extraordinaire for Claudin

timeline.subject: Claudin Aulbry
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to torture request (Remy among signatories)

timeline.subject: Claudin Aulbry
timeline.details: Racked for half hour, given water several times, quarter hour on strappado with 40 pound weight; maintained denials throughout

timeline.subject: Claudin Aulbry
timeline.details: PG des Vosges (Maimbourg) asks denials be disregarded and requests banishment from duchy and confiscation of goods

timeline.subject: Ysabeau wife of Claudin
timeline.details: Interrogated about calf husband supposedly killed; said family ate meat from dead calf but denied husband killed it

timeline.subject: Claudin Aulbry
timeline.details: Change de Nancy orders renvoyé jusqu'au rappel, told to conduct himself modestly so people have no cause to complain

accomplices_named.name: Jean Braconnier
accomplices_named.context: Previously executed witch mentioned in testimony; Claudin present at his execution 5 years before

prior_accusations.context: Called father Bastien Aulbry a witch more than 20 years before

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Aulbry (via witness Didier Pierrot)
notable_quotes.french: he would make him as poor as himself
notable_quotes.english: he would make him as poor as himself
notable_quotes.context: Threat after quarrel over soldiers incident

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudin Aulbry (via witness Claudin Didillot)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il se donneroit de garde bientost
notable_quotes.english: that he should be on his guard soon

notable_quotes.speaker: Claude femme de Jean Marsellot
notable_quotes.french: fort craings et doubté d'un chacun
notable_quotes.english: greatly feared and doubted by everyone
notable_quotes.context: Describing reputation of brothers and father

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudin Aulbry (via witness Margueritte femme à Claudon Didellot)
notable_quotes.french: que l'on parloit de luy et qu'on en dict ce qu'on vouldroit qu'il estoit homme le plus mauvais qui fut jamais sur terre et l'ung des bon aussy s'il le vouloit faire
notable_quotes.english: that people spoke of him and they could say what they wanted, that he was the worst man who ever lived on earth and one of the good ones too if he wanted to be
notable_quotes.context: Claudin's statement in their house previous winter

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudin Aulbry
notable_quotes.french: bien joyeux de ce qu'il est entre nos mains prisonnier affin que l'on n'aisse plus de suspitions sur luy et qu'on ne le regard plus de travers
notable_quotes.english: very happy to be prisoner in our hands so that they would have no more suspicions of him and no longer look at him askance
notable_quotes.context: During first interrogation, revealing awareness of reputation

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongin Viriot (via witness)
notable_quotes.context: Public warning to Claudin after foal became ill

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudotte fille de feu Claudon Didellot
notable_quotes.french: que c'estoit trop la faire aller en la maison d'un genot
notable_quotes.english: that it was too much to make her go to the house of a genot (witch/sorcerer)
notable_quotes.context: Angry statement to Jean over unpaid debt

notable_quotes.speaker: Jacquot du Prey (via witness)
notable_quotes.english: that he would make him answer for it

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongin Viriot questioning Claudin
notable_quotes.french: a quelle occasion qu'il l'avoit print hayne contre luy
notable_quotes.english: for what reason he had taken hatred against him
notable_quotes.context: After becoming ill following Jean Braconnier execution incident

notable_quotes.speaker: Witness about Mongin Viriot incident
notable_quotes.french: parolles assez suffisantes pour luy donner ample recognoissance qu'il luy avoit donné la maladie
notable_quotes.english: words sufficient enough to give him ample recognition that he had given him the illness
notable_quotes.context: Claudin's response interpreted as admission of causing illness

relationships.evidence_text: learned weaving from his mother Claude Lucaire
marry a few months later Alix Goyon of Repel
married Ysabel daughter of Mongenot Gerel of Dompmartin
living with another brother, Toussainct in Metz

Isabel femme de Mengin Viriot / Mongin Variot

relationships.person1: Claudotte fille de feu Claudon Didellot

withdrawn 2 cows belonging to his wife which Jean Aulbry had leased

Jean had owed her 11 francs for some corn and for rent

economic_context.details: Multiple economic tensions: Jean owed debts to several people (11 francs to Claudotte for corn and rent, 72 francs loan to Viriot Petit Jean); Claudin disputed subsidy assessment of 5 francs claiming shepherds exempt; disputes over leasing cows, buying meadow hay, payment for work; both accused described as poor, Jean doing agricultural work 'by which the poor normally earned their living'; Claudin abandoned being laboureur because could not pay rent for land; economic hardship clearly underlying many quarrels

harms_catalog.harm_description: ill for a year before being cured after consulting devin at Blainville

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrel when Jean wanted to attack soldiers, threw himself against witness's dagger

cow belonging to Jean Petit Jean

Claudin came asking to borrow 'un bichot' (a vessel/measure)

Money owed and repaid

historical_context.military_details: Soldiers billeted in village; gendarmes took bread from Jean's house to Didier Pierrot's house; quarrel arose when Jean wanted to attack billeted soldiers
economic_hardship_indicators: Jean described as doing agricultural work 'by which the poor normally earned their living'
Claudin abandoned being laboureur because could not pay rent for land
Jean told Claudotte he could not pay debt because needed to feed his children
Jean threatened Claudotte saying she might see her begging for livelihood
Jean threatened Didier Pierrot saying he would make him as poor as himself
Multiple debts and payment disputes throughout testimonies
religious_calendar_references: St. Jean (St. John's Day) - when Mongin Viriot was charged with levying subsidy

prior_legal_disputes.description: Claudin Didellot had been fined for woodland offences (mentioned by Claudin Aulbry during confrontations)
Nicolas Thouvenin and his wife convicted of selling bad meat, also accused of being thief (mentioned by Jean during confrontations)

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Guarded in house of Andreu Jacquinot by five men; mysterious spirit visit with three loud knocks at midnight

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Changed from execution to banishment ('renvoyé jusqu'au rappel'); ordered to conduct himself modestly

hearsay_chains.content: Claudin had been threatening that he would repent of the hay
several people thought Claudin had bewitched the horse
to inform Claudin that if foal died he would kill him
whether Jean Braconnier had denounced anyone of St. Prancher
said it was witchcraft and poison leaving her body

emotional_state_notes: During torture: calling on patron saint, protesting they were crippling him so he couldn't work
During first interrogation: claimed to be 'gens de bien' (good people)
Said he was 'bien joyeux' (very happy) to be prisoner so suspicions would end

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Claudin Didellot had been fined for woodland offences
Nicolas Thouvenin and his wife had been convicted of selling bad meat, and he was a thief

third_parties.name: Bastien Aulbry
third_parties.context: Father of accused, had reputation as witch, allegedly killed witness's father and bewitched Didier Pierrot's mother

third_parties.name: Jean Braconnier
third_parties.context: Executed witch from Delaucourt 5 years before; Claudin present at execution; incident at well after execution when someone wished he had accused all witches including Claudin

third_parties.name: Mengin Viriot
third_parties.context: Specialist in curing horses, told Claude Marsellot her horse was hopeless

third_parties.name: Toussainct Aulbry
third_parties.context: Another brother, Jean lived with him in Metz

third_parties.name: Francois Verrier
third_parties.context: Of Mirecourt, taught Claudin trade of retondeur

third_parties.name: Mongenot Gerel
third_parties.context: Father of Claudin's wife Ysabel, from Dompmartin

third_parties.name: Demenge Guenot
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: creditor to Viriot Petit Jean who stood guarantor
third_parties.context: Of Giecourt, lent 72 francs to Jean

third_parties.name: Didier Didellot
third_parties.context: Uncle at Genaincourt who cared for Claudotte when she was ill

third_parties.name: Claude Husson
third_parties.context: Alerted Claudin about Mongin Viriot's sick foal and threats

third_parties.name: late wife of Pancras Vincenot
third_parties.context: Had called father Bastien Aulbry a witch more than 20 years before

third_parties.name: son of Jean Petit Jean
third_parties.context: Was ploughing with Jean Collon as his associé when Claudin touched horse

third_parties.context: Interrogated about calf, defended husband, said never saw him have anything to do with witchcraft

third_parties.name: children of Claudin
third_parties.context: Called 'genots' by children of Jean Vincenot; Jean mentioned needing to feed his children

third_parties.name: chambermaid of Mongin Variot
third_parties.context: Told Mongin that Claudin had been threatening about the hay

third_parties.name: man who cut up calf
third_parties.context: Told Jean Vincenot he had never seen calf with side so damaged

third_parties.name: five guards
third_parties.context: Guarding brothers in house of Andreu Jacquinot when spirit visit occurred

third_parties.name: devin at Blainville
third_parties.context: Consulted by Didier Pierrot's mother, made pilgrimage to St. Genot on her behalf

extraction_metadata.notes: Complex trial involving two brothers with extensive witness testimony (35 witnesses). Jean Aulbry committed suicide before trial concluded. Claudin tortured extensively but maintained denials. Ultimately banished rather than executed. Rich detail on economic disputes, animal harms, reputation duration, and community dynamics. Notable for pattern of healing sick animals after confrontation. Military presence (billeted soldiers) mentioned. Reference to prior witch execution (Jean Braconnier). Mysterious spirit visit during imprisonment. Detailed economic context showing poverty and debt disputes underlying many accusations.
